questions.question_text: An organization is conducting an evaluation on the migration to IPv6 within the enterprise network and has requested clarification on recommended migration strategies. What three migration models would accomplish the organization's goal? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
ABD are correct
From CCDA 200-310 Certification Guide:
IPv6 deployment models are also divided into three major categories:
■ Dual-stack model: IPv4 and IPv6 coexist on hosts and the network.
■ Hybrid model: Combination of Intra-Site Automatic Tunneling Addressing Protocol
(ISATAP) or manually configured tunnels and dual-stack mechanisms.
■ Service block model: Combination of ISATAP and manually configured tunnels and
dual-stack mechanisms.

discussion.content: Shouldn't this be A,D and E ? IPv4 to IPv6 migration can be done in any of these 3 ways - Dual Stack, Hybrid or Tunneled.
There is no concept of Multicast in IPv6. Correct Answer is the AnyCast
Multicast is a wrong answer. Correct is Anycast...

questions.question_text: An application uses broadcast traffic to send data to IPv4 hosts. How can the application communicate using IPv6?
What significant advantage does EIGRP have over OSPF?

discussion.content: better answer is convergence times as the question is asking what is the most significant

I believe this would be D - OSPF being a Link State IGP would require more processing and memory to calculate SPF Algorithm and storing LSDBs respectively. EIGRP being an advanced Distance Vector IGP would be easy on processing power and memory requirements.

questions.question_text: By default, how does EIGRP's metric differ from OSPF?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
NetFlow offers the best combination of features for your requirements: precise time stamping, interface-level customization, minimal impact on network devices, and scalability for large networks.

questions.question_text: You want to gather as much detail as possible during a network audit with a minimal impact on the network devices themselves. Which tool would you use to include data time stamping across a large number of interfaces while being customized according to each interface?
